key_points: Hannah Gutierrez Reed was the gun expert on 'Rust' movie set where Alec Baldwin fatally shot a cinematographer.
Seth Kenney, another gun expert from Arizona, was working as an 'armorer mentor' for Gutierrez Reed.
Kenney's company supplied the guns used on the 'Rust' set, including the Colt .45 Baldwin used.
Kenney suggested Gutierrez Reed for the 'Rust' armorer position.
Investigation is unclear on the ammunition Kenney may have provided and his presence on the set.
Halyna Hutchins was killed and Joel Souza was wounded by a prop gun discharged by Baldwin, believed to be 'cold'.
Gutierrez Reed's lawyers suggested possible 'sabotage' on the set with the live bullet.
Reports of Gutierrez Reed's previous mishandling of firearms on another film set have emerged.
Nicolas Cage complained about Gutierrez Reed's handling of firearms during 'The Old Way' film production.
Kenney had a previous career working with major prop houses and as a weapons consultant on films.
